channel.title: Brisbane s calendar Light up Brisbane
channel.description: This calendar includes scheduled lights ups of Council assets including Story Bridge, Reddacliff Place sculptures, Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City Hall, King George Square, William Jolly Bridge and Tropical Dome at Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha.

item.title: Grandparents Day
item.description:
Sunday, October 27, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Orange and Yellow to celebrate Grandparents Day.

Grandparents Day celebrates the contributions grandparents make to celebrate families, shape futures and strengthen communities. It's a day to connect with older loved ones and celebrate what they mean to you. In Queensland, Grandparents Day is celebrated every year on the last Sunday in October. In 2023 it will be Sunday 29 October and will bring together people of all ages, cultures and abilities.

This Light Up is organised by: Department of Children, Youth Justice and Multicultural Affairs, in partnership with COTA

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Melt Open
item.description:
Monday, October 28, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Rainbow to celebrate Melt Open.

Melt is an open access festival of Queer art and culture premiering in Brisbane/Magandjin, Queensland, Australia from 23 October to 10 November 2024.

Born out of the success of Brisbane Powerhouse’s Melt Festival, Melt 2.0 takes pride in showcasing diverse arts and cultural events. With an expanded lineup of venues and artists, this destination city-wide festival aims to foster inclusivity, provoke thought and celebrate LGBTQIA+ communities and artists.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Powerhouse

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Light It Red for Dyslexia
item.description:
Tuesday, October 29, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to support Light It Red for Dyslexia.

Code REaD Dyslexia Network presents our 9th annual 'Light it Red for Dyslexia' campaign, designed to Raise Dyslexia Awareness by lighting significant monuments, buildings and landmarks RED during Dyslexia Awareness Month each October. #LIR2023 is set to make history with close to 100 structures across Australia participating in this year's light up event, making it the largest 'Light Up' ever in Australia.

This Light Up is organised by: Code Read Dyslexia Network Australia Limited

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Sexual Violence Awareness Month
item.description:
Wednesday, October 30, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Teal to support Sexual Violence Awareness Month.

October is Sexual Violence Awareness Month in Qld - SVAM. For 2024 Qld is focusing on 'SURVIVOR VOICES' as the theme for the month. The colour for SVAM is TEAL - teal ribbons, banners, shirts, cupcakes...... whatever helps raise attention. SVAM is a time for everyone in the community to focus on supporting survivors of sexual violence. it is also importantly, a time to reflect on this issue which is so widely experienced and consider what we as individuals, groups, and organisations, can do to help change the incidence of sexual violence. How can each and every one of us contribute to a change in attitude and actions - creating a safer, more respectful and aware community? How do we honour, hear and learn from, SURIVOR VOICES? Banners on landmarks and the colour TEAL, help to remind us all about this month. So keep an eye out around BRISBANE for banner sightings and splashes of TEAL. #SVAM 2024

This Light Up is organised by: Zig Zag Young Women's Resource Centre

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of YRNA Day
item.description:
Thursday, October 31, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Yellow to support YRNA Day.

The 1st of November will be the inaugural YRNA Day. This day aims to raise awareness around youth suicide and mental health, and falls on an important day in YRNA's calendar.

This Light Up is organised by: You Are Not Alone

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Diwali - Indian Festival of Light
item.description:
Friday, November 1, 2024

City Hall will be lit Green, White and Orange to celebrate Diwali - Indian Festival of Light.

FICQ welcomes you to Diwali 2024 – Come celebrate the Festival of Lights on Friday, 1 November at the iconic King George Square.

This will be a day full of non-stop entertainment with Bollywood and folk music and dance, a Live DJ, Indian and multicultural cuisine, Henna artistry, and arts and crafts stalls.

This Light Up is organised by: The Federation of Indian Communities of Qld Inc.

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Queensland Tonga Day
item.description:
Saturday, November 2, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Red to celebrate Queensland Tonga Day.

Queensland Tongan Day is a celebration of the Tongan culture here in Queensland ahead of the Tongan National Day of 4 November. This day commemorates the 149th anniversary of the Tongan Constitution being established by His Majesty Siaosi Tupou I in 1875.

This Light Up is organised by: The Brisbane Tongan Community Inc.

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

Queensland Tongan Day is a celebration of the Tongan culture here in Queensland ahead of the Tongan National Day of 4 November. This day commemorates the 149th anniversary of the Tongan Constitution being established by His Majesty Siaosi Tupou I in 1875.
This Light Up is organised by: The Brisbane Tongan Community Inc.

item.title: Colour the World Orange
item.description:
Monday, November 4, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Orange to support Colour the World Orange.

"Colour The World Orange" is an annual Global event that began in 2014. It occurs on the first Monday in November, and numerous landmarks around the world turn orange to raise awareness about CRPS.

CRPS Awareness - The Purple Bucket Foundation Inc. is committed to providing support and concise information about Complex Regional Pain Syndrome and other Chronic Pain conditions through research, education and awareness campaigns.

This Light Up is organised by: CRPS Awareness - The Purple Bucket Foundation INC.

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: The Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Tuesday, November 5, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support The Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal.

For more than 70 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grants where charities apply to help vital community services and grassroots initiatives, particularly at Christmas.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Bluey's World Live - Opening Night
item.description:
Thursday, November 7, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Blue to celebrate Bluey's World Live - Opening Night.

Bluey’s World is a world-first, immersive and innovative experience, taking the beloved show Bluey from screen to real life. Audiences will be welcomed into the world of Bluey through interactive magical play and immersive adventures, all brought to life through set designs showcasing the iconic 'Bluey' locations in a bespoke-built venue at the Northshore Pavilion.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane Economic Development Agency

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: The Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Friday, November 8, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support The Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal.

For more than 70 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grants where charities apply to help vital community services and grassroots initiatives, particularly at Christmas.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.description:
Saturday, November 9, 2024

City Hall will be lit Rainbow to celebrate Melt Open - River Pride Parade.

Dive into the vibrant waves of joy and celebration at Brisbane’s first-ever River Pride Parade on Saturday, 9 November! 

Starting at 3pm, the flotilla of vessels dressed in colour and sparkle will make the journey from William Jolly Bridge to Brisbane Powerhouse. This family-friendly event is Brisbane’s own Mardi Gras Parade on the water and is a floating celebration of LGBTQIA+ communities and allies.

MELT Open is an 'open access' festival of Queer arts held annually in central

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: The Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Saturday, November 9, 2024

The Tropical Dome  will be lit Purple to support The Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal.

For more than 70 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grants where charities apply to help vital community services and grassroots initiatives, particularly at Christmas.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Tropical Display Dome, Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha
Venue address: Brisbane Botanic Gardens Mt Coot-tha, 152 Mt Coot-tha Road, Toowong

item.title: Eve of Remembrance Day
item.description:
Sunday, November 10, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Red to commemorate the Eve of Remembrance Day.

Remember to remember. 

This Remembrance Day, join the world in honouring those who gave their lives in service.  

Saturday 11 November 2023 marks the anniversary of the Armistice that ended fighting with Germany in World War I.  

Every year at the 11th hour of the 11th day of the 11th month, millions around the globe pause in silence to remember the sacrifices many have made so we can enjoy life today.

This Light Up is organised by: RSL Queensland

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point
item.x-trumba:customfield: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

item.title: National Recycling Week
item.description:
Tuesday, November 12, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green and Yellow to celebrate National Recycling Week.

Every year, National Recycling Week aims to educate and empower people to do the right thing when they're at the bin.

National Recycling Week is one of Planet Ark's flagship campaigns for helping Australians to recycle right.

Recycling helps reduce the amount of waste that ends up in landfill, which is good for the environment and our communities.

This Light Up is organised by: Brisbane City Council

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World Pneumonia Awareness Day
item.description:
Tuesday, November 12, 2024

City Hall will be lit Blue to support World Pneumonia Awareness Day.

The Worldwide Pneumonia Awareness Campaign ‘Pneumolight’ is a non-profit, collaborative project committed to increasing the visibility of pneumonia worldwide and to raising public awareness of its risks. FREO2 is a member of the Every Breath Count Coalition, who has the support of 30 organisations globally aiming to raise he awareness that pneumonia, is an infectious disease that has a huge impact in global health. In 2019, 2.5 million people died due to pneumonia. Our campaign aims to give visibility to pneumonia and share educational information about pneumonia diagnosis and prevention.

This Light Up is organised by: FREO2 Foundation Australia Limited

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Shine a Light on Lung Cancer
item.description:
Thursday, November 14, 2024

The Story Bridge will be lit Green to support Shine a Light on Lung Cancer.

"Shine a Light on Lung Cancer" is a multifaceted event and awareness campaign, to increase public understanding and awareness of lung cancer, to support research for diagnosis and treatment of lung cancer, and engage the community in activities that support lung cancer patients and their families. 

We are shining a light on lung cancer to raise funds to change the lung cancer space for the better, with our annual ‘Shine a Light’ walk taking place in City Botanic Gardens on Saturday 16 November.

This Light Up is organised by: Lung Foundation Australia

Venue: Story Bridge, Kangaroo Point
Venue address: Story Bridge, Main Street, Kangaroo Point

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Green to support Shine a Light on Lung Cancer.

"Shine a Light on Lung Cancer" is a multifaceted event and awareness campaign, to increase public understanding and awareness of lung cancer, to support research for diagnosis and treatment of lung cancer, and engage the community in activities that support lung cancer patients and their families. 

We are shining a light on lung cancer to raise funds to change the lung cancer space for the better, with our annual ‘Shine a Light’ walk taking place in City Botanic Gardens on Saturday 16 November.

This Light Up is organised by: Lung Foundation Australia

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World Sanfilippo Awareness Day
item.description:
Saturday, November 16, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit Purple to support World Sanfilippo Awareness Day.

The Sanfilippo Children's Foundation drives research for a world without Sanfilippo syndrome, a rare yet devastating disease that leads to childhood dementia. The 16th of November marks World Sanfilippo Awareness Day, a day to spread global awareness of Sanfilippo syndrome, to honour children around the world living with Sanfilippo today, and those we have lost to this heart breaking disease. It also honours the families of these precious children.

This Light Up is organised by: Sanfilippo Children's Foundation

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: World Prematurity Day
item.description:
Sunday, November 17, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support World Prematurity Day.

World Prematurity Day is celebrated on 17 November each year to raise awareness of the nearly 15 million babies born premature each year. Worldwide and the nearly 1 million who lose their fight for life. Landmarks around the World are lit up purple on this Day to raise awareness of the plight of babies born premature and to honour the struggles of these babies to survive and thrive. It also raises awareness of parent groups like PIPA (Preterm Infants Parents Association).

This Light Up is organised by: PIPA (Preterm Infants Parents Association)

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: The Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal
item.description:
Monday, November 18, 2024

The Victoria Bridge will be lit Purple to support The Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust Christmas Appeal.

For more than 70 years, the Trust’s fundraising efforts have improved the wellbeing of the most marginalised, vulnerable members of the Brisbane community. Established in the 1960s, the Trust continues the good work of the Lord Mayor whose mission is to improve the liveability of all Brisbane residents. The Trust’s work supports charities that assist people suffering from disability, homelessness, mental illness, drug or alcohol addiction, trauma, abuse or neglect. The annual Christmas Appeal raises funds for our Christmas grants where charities apply to help vital community services and grassroots initiatives, particularly at Christmas.

This Light Up is organised by: Lord Mayor's Charitable Trust

Venue: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City
Venue address: Victoria Bridge, Brisbane City

item.title: Eve of World Children's Day
item.description:
Tuesday, November 19, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptureswill be lit Teal to support Eve of World Children's Day.

Every year, World Children's Day is celebrated on 20 November, marking the date that the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child was adopted. This year is the 35th Anniversary of the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child. It is the most widely ratified human rights treaty in history and has helped transform children’s lives around the world.

Children’s Rights Queensland was founded in 1971 and has a rich history of promoting the rights of children and supporting communities. The organisation convenes Children's Week each year in Queensland and delivers a range of other initiatives that raise awareness of the needs, rights and achievements of children.

This Light Up is organised by: Children's Rights Queensland

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Transgender Day of Remembrance
item.description:
Wednesday, November 20, 2024

The Reddacliff Place sculptures will be lit all colours  to support Transgender Day of Remembrance.

Many Genders One Voice holds a Transgender Day of Remembrance ceremony every year, as part of other international events that occur during Transgender Awareness Week. This week aims to help raise the visibility of transgender, gender diverse and non-binary people, and address the issues the community faces. The final day of Transgender Awareness Week is Transgender Day of Remembrance (TDOR), an annual observance on 20 November that honours the memory of those whose lives were lost in acts of anti-transgender violence.

This Light Up is organised by: Many Genders One Voice

Venue: Reddacliff Place, Brisbane City
Venue address: Reddacliff Place, 266 George Street, Brisbane City

item.title: Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Month
item.description:
Thursday, November 21, 2024

City Hall will be lit Purple to support Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Month.

November 21 is World Pancreatic Cancer Awareness Day. Pancreatic cancer is currently responsible for the 3rd highest amount of cancer deaths, and thus is an extremely deadly cancer in Australia. On this day, we are asking venues across the globe to turn purple to honour those lost to pancreatic cancer or currently fighting, as well as raise important awareness for this disease. With only a 12.5% chance of survival beyond 5 years.

This Light Up is organised by: Pankind

Venue: Brisbane City Hall, Brisbane City
Venue address: Brisbane City Hall, 64 Adelaide Street, Brisbane City
